code: @Manual{,   title = {samesies: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers},   author = {Dylan Pieper},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://dylanpieper.github.io/samesies/}, }

what: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare lists texts, factors, numerical values measure similarity. Use cases include comparing responses multiple raters, evaluating model outputs, assessing data consistency.

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: can install samesies CRAN :
code: install.packages("samesies")

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: samesies provides three main functions measuring similarity:

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare similarity multiple lists character strings: Methods available via stringdist (e.g., method = "osa"): osa, lv, dl hamming, lcs, qgram, cosine, jaccard jw, soundex
code: library(samesies)  r1 <- list("R is a statistical computing software",             "R enables grammar of graphics using ggplot2",             "R supports advanced statistical models") r2 <- list("R is a full-stack programming language",            "R enables advanced data visualizations",             "R supports machine learning algorithms")  tex <- same_text(r1, r2) #> ✔ Computed osa scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.43] #> ✔ Computed lv scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.43] #> ✔ Computed dl scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.43] #> ✔ Computed hamming scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.123] #> ✔ Computed lcs scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.061] #> ✔ Computed qgram scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.682] #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.771] #> ✔ Computed jaccard scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.735] #> ✔ Computed jw scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.818] #> ✔ Computed soundex scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.667]

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare similarity multiple lists categorical data: Compare similarity based ordered factors: Methods available (e.g., method = "exact"): exact: Exact matching order: Distances across ordered factor levels
code: f1 <- list("R", "R", "Python") f2 <- list("R", "Python", "R")  fct <- same_factor(f1, f2) #> ℹ Skipping 'order' method as factor levels are not ordered #> ✔ Computed exact scores for "f1_f2" [mean: 0.333] of1 <- list("High School", "Bachelor's", "Master's", "PhD") of2 <- list("Bachelor's", "High School", "PhD", "Master's")  edu_comparison <- same_factor(of1, of2,                                levels = c("High School", "Bachelor's", "Master's", "PhD"))  fct_ordered <- average_similarity(edu_comparison) #> ✔ Computed exact scores for "of1_of2" [mean: 0] #> ✔ Computed order scores for "of1_of2" [mean: 0.667]

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare similarity multiple lists numeric values: Methods available (e.g., method = "exact"): exact: Exact matching raw: Absolute difference exp: Exponential decay absolute difference pct_diff: Percentage difference normalized: Normalized difference Uses two tolerance thresholds: absolute (calculated) relative (default 2%) Calculation absolute threshold averages data variability (10% standard deviation), magnitude (0.5% mean absolute values), range (1% value range) Effective threshold larger two values Perfect matches (score = 1.0) difference ≤ effective threshold Scores decrease smoothly differences exceed threshold
code: n1 <- list(1, 2, 3) n2 <- list(1, 2.1, 3.2)  num <- same_number(n1, n2) #> ✔ Computed exact scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.333] #> ✔ Computed raw scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.1] #> ✔ Computed exp scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.908] #> ✔ Computed percent scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.963] #> ✔ Computed normalized scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.955] #> ✔ Computed fuzzy scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.977]

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: control results, can use named lists specify custom labels comparisons:
code: result_number <- same_number("baseline" = n1, "treatment" = n2, method = "fuzzy") #> ✔ Computed fuzzy scores for "baseline_treatment" [mean: 0.978]

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: input two lists, samesies computes pairwise comparisons across lists:
code: r1 <- list("Statistical computing", "Data visualization", "Machine learning") r2 <- list("Statistical software", "Data plotting", "ML algorithms")  r3 <- list("Statistical analysis", "Data graphics", "AI models")  multi_text <- same_text(r1, r2, r3, method = "cosine") #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "r1_r2" [mean: 0.717] #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "r1_r3" [mean: 0.607] #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "r2_r3" [mean: 0.68]

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: Compare nested lists identical structure names:
code: nest1 <- list(   group_a = list("Good", "Very Good", "Fair"),   group_b = list("Excellent", "Good", "Poor") )  nest2 <- list(   group_a = list("Very Good", "Good", "Fair"),    group_b = list("Good", "Excellent", "Fair")   )  nested_result <- same_text(nest1, nest2, method = "jw") #> ✔ Computed jw scores for "nest1_nest2" [mean: 0.25]

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: three functions return similar objects support following methods:
code: result <- same_text(r1, r2, method = "cosine")  # Print detailed results print(result)  # Summarize results   summary(result) #>  method  pair avg_score #>  cosine r1_r2     0.771  # Get average similarity scores average_similarity(result) #> cosine  #>  0.771  # Get pair-wise averages pair_averages(result)   #>   method  pair avg_score #> 1 cosine r1_r2     0.771

title: Compare Similarity Across Text, Factors, or Numbers
text: package uses S3 objects, allowing access underlying data using $: Available components: scores: list similarity scores method comparison pair summary: list statistical summaries method comparison pair methods: similarity methods used analysis list_names: Names input lists raw_values: original input values digits: Number decimal places rounding results output
code: result <- same_text(r1, r2, method = "cosine")  # Access similarity scores result$scores #> $cosine #> $cosine$r1_r2 #>       R is a statistical computing software  #>                                   0.7917448  #> R enables grammar of graphics using ggplot2  #>                                   0.7027498  #>      R supports advanced statistical models  #>                                   0.8197365  # Access methods used   result$methods #> [1] "cosine"  # Access list names result$list_names   #> [1] "r1" "r2"

One : "exact", "percent", "normalized", "fuzzy", "exp", "raw" epsilon Threshold fuzzy matching. used method "fuzzy" max_diff Maximum difference normalization. used method "normalized" epsilon_pct Relative epsilon percentile (default: 0.02 2%). used method "fuzzy"

what: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
title: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
text: Computes similarity scores two lists factors enums. Implements exact matching methods precise category equivalence order-preserving comparisons.

title: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
code: same_factor(   ...,   method = c("exact", "order"),   levels,   ordered = FALSE,   digits = 3 )

title: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
text: ... Lists categorical values (character factor) compare. method Character vector similarity method (default: c("exact", "order")). levels Character vector allowed levels comparison. ordered Logical. TRUE, treat levels ordered (ordinal). FALSE, "order" method skipped. digits Number digits round results (default: 3).

title: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
text: S3 object type "similar_factor" containing: scores: Numeric similarity scores method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Methods used comparison list_names: Names compared lists levels: Levels used categorical comparison

title: Compare Factor Similarity Across Lists — same_factor
code: list1 <- list("high", "medium", "low") list2 <- list("high", "low", "medium")  # Using unnamed lists result1 <- same_factor(   list1, list2,   levels = c("low", "medium", "high"),   ordered = TRUE ) #> Error in validate_factor_inputs(..., levels = levels): All inputs must be lists containing only character or factor values #> ✖ Invalid inputs at position(s): 3  # Using named lists for more control result2 <- same_factor(   "l1" = list1, "l2" = list2,   levels = c("low", "medium", "high"),   ordered = TRUE ) #> Error in validate_factor_inputs(..., levels = levels): All inputs must be lists containing only character or factor values #> ✖ Invalid inputs at position(s): 3

what: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: Computes similarity scores two lists numeric values. Applies various mathematical comparison methods including exact matching, percentage differences, normalized differences, fuzzy threshold-based matching, exponential decay metrics.

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
code: same_number(   ...,   method = c("exact", "raw", "exp", "percent", "normalized", "fuzzy"),   epsilon = 0.05,   epsilon_pct = 0.02,   max_diff = NULL,   digits = 3 )

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: ... Two lists containing numeric values compare. method Character vector specifying similarity methods (default: c("exact", "raw", "exp", "percent", "normalized", "fuzzy")). epsilon Threshold fuzzy matching (default: NULL auto-calculation). epsilon_pct Relative epsilon percentile "fuzzy" method (default: 0.02). max_diff Maximum difference normalization (default: NULL auto-calculation). digits Number digits round results (default: 3).

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: S3 object containing: scores: list similarity scores method list pair summary: list statistical summaries method list pair methods: similarity methods used list_names: Names input lists raw_values: original input lists

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
text: available methods : exact: Binary similarity (1 equal, 0 otherwise) percent: Percentage difference relative larger value normalized: Absolute difference normalized maximum difference value fuzzy: Similarity based epsilon threshold exp: Exponential decay based absolute difference (e^-diff) raw: Returns raw absolute difference (|num1 - num2|) instead similarity score

title: Compare Numerical Similarity Across Lists — same_number
code: list1 <- list(1, 2, 3) list2 <- list(1, 2.1, 3.2)  # Using unnamed lists result1 <- same_number(list1, list2) #> ✔ Computed exact scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.333] #> ✔ Computed raw scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.1] #> ✔ Computed exp scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.908] #> ✔ Computed percent scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.963] #> ✔ Computed normalized scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.955] #> ✔ Computed fuzzy scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.977]  # Using named lists for more control result2 <- same_number("n1" = list1, "n2" = list2) #> ✔ Computed exact scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.333] #> ✔ Computed raw scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.1] #> ✔ Computed exp scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.908] #> ✔ Computed percent scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.963] #> ✔ Computed normalized scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.955] #> ✔ Computed fuzzy scores for "n1_n2" [mean: 0.977]

what: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
text: Computes similarity scores two lists character strings. Implements multiple string distance algorithms including edit-based methods (OSA, Levenshtein, Damerau-Levenshtein, Hamming), sequence-based approaches (LCS), q-gram techniques (qgram, cosine, jaccard), phonetic matching (soundex), hybrid methods (Jaro-Winkler).

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
code: same_text(   ...,   method = c("osa", "lv", "dl", "hamming", "lcs", "qgram", "cosine", "jaccard", "jw",     "soundex"),   q = 1,   p = NULL,   bt = 0,   weight = c(d = 1, i = 1, s = 1, t = 1),   digits = 3 )

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
text: ... Lists character strings compare. method Character vector similarity methods stringdist (default: c("osa", "lv", "dl", "hamming", "lcs", "qgram", "cosine", "jaccard", "jw", "soundex")). q Size q-gram "qgram", "cosine", "jaccard" methods (default: 1). p Winkler scaling factor "jw" method (default: 0.1). bt Booth matching threshold "jw" method (default: 0). weight Vector weights operations: deletion (d), insertion (), substitution (s), transposition (t) "osa", "lv", "dl" methods. digits Number digits round results (default: 3).

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
text: S3 class object type "similar_text" containing: scores: Numeric similarity scores method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Methods used comparison list_names: Names compared lists

title: Compare Text Similarity Across Lists — same_text
code: list1 <- list("hello", "world") list2 <- list("helo", "word")  # Using unnamed lists result1 <- same_text(list1, list2) #> ✔ Computed osa scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed lv scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed dl scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed hamming scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0] #> ✔ Computed lcs scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed qgram scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.889] #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.92] #> ✔ Computed jaccard scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.9] #> ✔ Computed jw scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.953] #> ✔ Computed soundex scores for "list1_list2" [mean: 0.5]  # Using named lists for more control result2 <- same_text("l1" = list1, "l2" = list2) #> ✔ Computed osa scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed lv scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed dl scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed hamming scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0] #> ✔ Computed lcs scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.8] #> ✔ Computed qgram scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.889] #> ✔ Computed cosine scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.92] #> ✔ Computed jaccard scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.9] #> ✔ Computed jw scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.953] #> ✔ Computed soundex scores for "l1_l2" [mean: 0.5]

what: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: similar S3 class similarity comparison objects. class defines common properties shared among child classes like similar_text, similar_factor, similar_number.

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
code: similar(scores, summary, methods, list_names, digits = 3)

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: scores List similarity scores per method comparison summary Summary statistics method comparison methods Character vector methods used comparison list_names Character vector names compared lists digits Number digits round results (default: 3)

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: object class "similar" following components: scores: List similarity scores per method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Character vector methods used comparison list_names: Character vector names compared lists digits: Number digits round results output similarity scores normalized values 0 1, 1 indicates perfect similarity 0 indicates similarity.

title: Abstract parent class for similarity comparison — similar
text: class provides foundation similarity comparison classes. includes common properties: scores: List similarity scores per method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Character vector methods used comparison list_names: Character vector names compared lists digits: Number digits round results output

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
text: similar_factor S3 class categorical/factor similarity comparisons.

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
code: similar_factor(scores, summary, methods, list_names, levels, digits = 3)

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
text: scores List similarity scores per method comparison summary Summary statistics method comparison methods Character vector methods used comparison list_names Character vector names compared lists levels Character vector factor levels digits Number digits round results (default: 3)

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
text: object class "similar_factor" (inherits "similar") containing: scores: List factor similarity scores per method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Character vector factor comparison methods used (exact, order) list_names: Character vector names compared factor lists digits: Number digits round results output levels: Character vector factor levels used comparison factor similarity scores normalized values 0 1, 1 indicates identical factors 0 indicates completely different factors based specific method used.

title: Factor similarity comparison class — similar_factor
text: class extends similar class implements categorical data-specific similarity comparison methods.

title: Numeric similarity comparison class — similar_number
text: similar_number S3 class numeric similarity comparisons.

title: Numeric similarity comparison class — similar_number
code: similar_number(scores, summary, methods, list_names, raw_values, digits = 3)

title: Numeric similarity comparison class — similar_number
text: scores List similarity scores per method comparison summary Summary statistics method comparison methods Character vector methods used comparison list_names Character vector names compared lists raw_values List raw numeric values compared digits Number digits round results (default: 3)

title: Numeric similarity comparison class — similar_number
text: object class "similar_number" (inherits "similar") containing: scores: List numeric similarity scores per method comparison summary: Summary statistics method comparison methods: Character vector numeric comparison methods used (exact, percent, normalized, fuzzy, exp, raw) list_names: Character vector names compared numeric lists digits: Number digits round results output raw_values: List raw numeric values compared numeric similarity scores normalized values 0 1, 1 indicates identical numbers 0 indicates maximally different numbers based specific method used. exception "raw" method, returns absolute difference values.

title: Numeric similarity comparison class — similar_number
text: class extends similar class implements numeric data-specific similarity comparison methods.
